intro: Amphistelma pallidum, commonly known as the pale starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is found in temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it often forms dense mats in its native habitat. Amphistelma pallidum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
